p: In summary, our results show that BACE1 rs638405 is associated with an increased risk for developing PD, increasing the spectrum of neurodegenerative diseases that this variant plays a role in. These results, together with recently published works showing that A Î² levels are altered in patients with PD in both Norwegian ParkWest study [ 14, 27, 28] and other studies [ 29], suggest an interesting area of research, linking common genetic risk factors with AD and overlapping pathogenic mechanisms leading to altered APP processing.
